name: Rose Clover
overview: An annual herb, meaning it goes from seedling to germination and dies within one year. As an introduced species, it often outcompetes native grasses and poses a moderate threat. It is often used as a cover crop for agriculture because of that. Its seeds are eaten by many herbivores and birds.
habitat: Originally from Turkey, it was brought to North America as a cover crop and now range states from California and Oregon to Florida and other east coast states. It prefers elevation below 6000 ft and well drained soils. It performs well on strongly acidic soils and when the fall rains occur in warm weather. It is commonly found on roadsides as it prefers disturbed soils.
tags: purple flower Rose Clover Trifolium hirtum plant
